translated: The Collection of Triads🔽The First Chapter
Wandering on, I went to hell,
Again and again to the realm of ghosts;
In the animal realm, too, I suffered,

original: Nekadhā hi vusitaṁ ciraṁ mayā.🔽Mānusopi ca bhavobhirādhito,
analyzed: na ekadhā hi vusitam ciram mayā  ca
translated: For I lived there for a long time in many ways.
And though I was born as a human, I was still unsatisfied,🔽Again and again I went to the heavenly world;
In the form realm and the formless realm,🔽I remained in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the base of nothingness.
I understood that all these existences are insubstantial,
Having understood the origin of the great mass,
The mindful one entered into peace.
